item.title: Find Answers to Your Questions
item.description: We can prepare for general conference by pondering questions. Guidance and direction will come as we listen to the messages of living prophets. To view all General Conference videos see Broadcast Archives

item.title: Look for the Lord's Hand - Veme
item.description: "Look for the Lord’s hand not only in the past, not only in our day, but also in the days to come." —Neil L. Andersen

item.title: God Hears Your Silent Prayers - Veme
item.description: "God hears your silent prayers, but you may have to learn to shut out the distractions." —Henry B. Eyring

item.title: Dreams for Our Children - Veme
item.description: "We share many of the same struggles, the same adjustments, and the same hopes, worries, and dreams for our children."—L. Tom Perry

item.title: Our Heavenly Father Wishes to Bless His Children - Veme
item.description: "Our Heavenly Father wishes to bless His children spiritually and temporally. He understands each of their needs, their pains, and their hopes." —Henry B. Eyring

item.title: Faith in the Sabbath - Veme
item.description: "Faith in God engenders a love for the Sabbath; faith in the Sabbath engenders a love for God." —Russell M. Nelson

item.title: How We Live Our Religion - Veme
item.description: "How we live our religion is far more important than what we may say about our religion." —Robert D. Hales

item.title: The Path of Discipleship - Veme
item.description: "With the gift of God’s grace, the path of discipleship does not lead backward; it leads upward.” —Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: The Wisdom of Him Who Knoweth All Things - Veme
item.description: “With prophets ancient and modern, I testify that ‘all things have been done in the wisdom of him who knoweth all things.’”—Jeffrey R. Holland

item.title: The Blessings of the Temple - Veme
item.description: "The blessings of the temple are priceless." —Thomas S. Monson

item.title: We Are on His Errand - Veme
item.description: "We are on His errand. Let us learn of Him. Let us follow in His footsteps. Let us live by His precepts." —Thomas S. Monson

item.title: A Consecrated Life - Veme
item.description: “Even the smallest act of discipleship or the tiniest ember of belief can become a blazing bonfire of a consecrated life.”—Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Following His Light - Veme
item.description: "Following His light and example will bring us joy, happiness, and peace." —Quentin L. Cook

item.title: Essential Things - Veme
item.description: "Many things are good, many are important, but only a few are essential."—D. Todd Christofferson

item.title: Source of Enduring Peace - Veme
item.description: "Correct knowledge of and faith in the Lord empower us to hush our fears."—David A. Bednar

item.title: Spiritual Food - Veme
item.description: "Spiritual food is necessary for spiritual survival." —Dallin H. Oaks

item.title: The Plan of Happiness - Veme
item.description: "The greatest reward we have received in this life, and the life to come, is our children and grandchildren.” —Boyd K. Packer

item.title: Henry B. Eyring General Women's Session March 2015
item.description: We lighten the loads of others best by helping The Lord strengthen them

item.title: Sharing Your Light
item.description: Neill F. Marriott shares how to share the gospel and it's blessing with others.

item.title: Prepared in a Manner That Never Had Been Known
item.description: Linda K. Burton talks about spiritual preparation.

item.title: Living the Gospel Joyful
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf gives insight into enjoying the blessings of living the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Covenant Daughters of God
item.description: Jean A. Stevens speaks on the importance of covenants.

item.title: Highlight: Until We Meet Again—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson expresses his hope that the spirit Latter-day Saints felt during general conference may abide with them.

item.title: Highlight: The Resurrection of Jesus Christ—D. Todd Christofferson
item.description: D. Todd Christofferson shares many of the scriptural witnesses of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ as well as his own testimony.

item.title: Highlight: If Ye Lack Wisdom—Marcos A. Aidukaitis
item.description: Marcos A. Aidukaitis gives guidance for recognizing truth—observing its fruits, experimenting on the word of God, and seeking personal revelation.

item.title: Highlight: Where Your Treasure Is—Michael John U. Teh
item.description: Michael John U. Teh teaches how we can make sure to put the things of God first in our lives rather than the things of this world.

item.title: Highlight: The Prophet Joseph Smith—Lawrence E. Corbridge
item.description: Lawrence E. Corbridge testifies of the important doctrine restored by the Prophet Joseph Smith.

item.title: Highlight: Obedience through Our Faithfulness—L. Tom Perry
item.description: L. Tom Perry teaches that obedience is a choice to trust in God's unlimited wisdom and power rather than our own limited knowledge and power.

item.title: Highlight: Live True to the Faith—William R. Walker
item.description: William R. Walker encourages Latter-day Saints to live true to the faith, honoring the legacy of their faithful ancestors.

item.title: Highlight: The Witness—Boyd K. Packer
item.description: Boyd K. Packer testifies of God the Father, Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Highlight: Love—the Essence of the Gospel—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches how small acts of love, kindness, and forgiveness can make a big difference in others' lives.

item.title: Highlight: Bear Up Their Burdens with Ease—David A. Bednar
item.description: David A. Bednar teaches that our challenges help us learn to rely on the Savior's Atonement.

item.title: Highlight: Your Four Minutes—Gary E. Stevenson
item.description: Gary E. Stevenson uses examples of Olympic athletes to illustrate how we should conduct our relatively short but all-important mortal lives.

item.title: Highlight: “Fear Not; I Am With Thee”—Jean A. Stevens
item.description: Jean A. Stevens teaches how greater faith and trust in the Lord can help us find peace and overcome challenges.

item.title: Highlight: Following Up—M. Russell Ballard
item.description: M. Russell Ballard encourages Latter-day Saints to be faithful missionaries and to follow up on their missionary efforts.

item.title: Highlight: Grateful in Any Circumstances—Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that we can choose to be grateful in any circumstances, including in the midst of tribulation.

item.title: Highlight: Be Strong and of a Good Courage—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson counsels priesthood holders to have moral courage in these challenging times and to be willing to defend their beliefs.

item.title: Highlight: The Priesthood Man—Henry B. Eyring
item.description: Henry B. Eyring teaches men how they can follow—and be—examples of selfless priesthood service.

item.title: Highlight: Are You Sleeping through the Restoration?—Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf cautions that selfishness, addictions, and competing priorities can keep us from giving our best effort as disciples of Christ.

item.title: Highlight: The Choice Generation—Randall L. Ridd
item.description: Randall L. Ridd offers four principles to help young men educate their desires and use technology wisely.

item.title: Highlight: What Manner of Men?—Donald L. Hallstrom
item.description: Donald L. Hallstrom urges priesthood holders to be willing to change in order to become more like the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: Highlight: The Keys and Authority of the Priesthood—Dallin H. Oaks
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks teaches how men and women, though they have different roles, serve and are blessed on the same terms through the priesthood.

item.title: Highlight: Roots and Branches—Quentin L. Cook
item.description: Quentin L. Cook teaches the importance of hastening family history and temple work in our day, including through modern technology.

item.title: Highlight: What Do You Think?—W. Craig Zwick
item.description: W. Craig Zwick encourages empathy for others and teaches that we must strive to understand what others are thinking.

item.title: Highlight: “If Ye Love Me, Keep My Commandments”—Robert D. Hales
item.description: Robert D. Hales teaches of the blessings that come when we use our agency to obey God's commandments, as the Savior Jesus Christ did.

item.title: Highlight: "I Have Given You an Example"—Richard G. Scott
item.description: Richard G. Scott explains how we can follow the Savior's example and be a loving influence for good in the lives of others.

item.title: Highlight: Let Your Faith Show—Russell M. Nelson
item.description: Russell M. Nelson counsels us to increase our faith by living our religion. He encourages us not to hide our faith but to let it show.

item.title: Highlight: A Priceless Heritage of Hope—Henry B. Eyring
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages us to leave an inheritance of hope for those who will follow our example.

item.title: Highlight: Spiritual Whirlwinds—Neil L. Andersen
item.description: Neil L. Andersen encourages youth to trust in God during challenges and promises that they will receive the Lord's protection and guidance.

item.title: Highlight: Protection from Pornography—a Christ-Focused Home—Linda S. Reeves
item.description: Linda S. Reeves warns families of the dangers of pornography and explains that the best filter is a strong testimony.

item.title: Highlight: Christ the Redeemer—Carlos H. Amado
item.description: Carlos H. Amado testifies that all who have lived or will live on earth are blessed by the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Highlight: The Joyful Burden of Discipleship—Ronald A. Rasband
item.description: Ronald A. Rasband teaches that we can receive joy by serving each other and bearing one other's burdens as disciples of the Lord.

item.title: Highlight: The Cost—and Blessings—of Discipleship—Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland encourages us to live the gospel faithfully and courageously, even when it is difficult.

item.title: Highlight: Welcome to Conference—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson opens general conference and tells of his experiences at the dedication of the Gilbert Arizona Temple.

item.title: Come, O Thou King of Kings
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Come, O Thou King of Kings.”

item.title: A Priceless Heritage of Hope
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages us to leave an inheritance of hope for those who will follow our example.

item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “A New Commandment I Give unto You.”

item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Choose the Right.”

item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Lead, Kindly Light.”

item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Press Forward, Saints.”

item.description: A combined choir from the Orem Institute of Religion sings “High on the Mountain Top.”

item.description: Quentin L. Cook teaches the importance of hastening family history and temple work in our day, including through modern technology.

item.description: W. Craig Zwick encourages empathy for others and teaches that we must strive to understand what others are thinking.

item.title: Let’s Not Take the Wrong Way
item.description: Claudio D. Zivic counsels us to stay on the gospel path by keeping the commandments and to repent when we need to get back on the right path.

item.title: “If Ye Love Me, Keep My Commandments”
item.description: Robert D. Hales teaches of the blessings that come when we use our agency to obey God's commandments, as the Savior Jesus Christ did.

item.description: The choir and congregation sing “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet.”

item.description: Russell M. Nelson counsels us to increase our faith by living our religion. He encourages us not to hide our faith but to let it show.

item.description: Church Auditing Department managing director Kevin R. Jergensen reads the auditing report for 2013.

item.title: The Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf presents the names of General Authorities and general Church officers to the membership for a sustaining vote.

item.description: A combined choir from the Orem Institute of Religion sings “I Lived in Heaven.”

item.description: Boyd K. Packer testifies of God the Father, Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost.

item.title: I Stand All Amazed
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “I Stand All Amazed.”

item.title: Sweet Is the Work
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Sweet Is the Work.”

item.title: Hark, All Ye Nations!
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Hark, All Ye Nations!”

item.title: Daughters in His Kingdom
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society choir from stakes in the Wasatch Front sings “Daughters in His Kingdom.”

item.title: Keeping Covenants Protects Us, Prepares Us, and Empowers Us
item.description: Rosemary M. Wixom encourages girls and women of all ages to make and keep sacred covenants in order to return to Heavenly Father's presence.

item.title: Video Presentation: I Am a Child of God
item.description: Women and children from around the world come together to declare, “I am a child of God.”

item.title: Sisterhood: Oh, How We Need Each Other
item.description: Bonnie L. Oscarson teaches that we can learn from girls and women of all ages and that we must avoid judging each other.

item.title: Video Presentation: Walk in His Light
item.description: Daughters of God support and love one another as they live covenant-centered lives.

item.title: Wanted: Hands and Hearts to Hasten the Work
item.description: Linda K. Burton teaches that we can be devoted disciples of Jesus Christ by serving others and furthering the work of salvation.

item.title: Hymn Medley: Lord, I Would Follow Thee—Love One Another
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society choir from stakes in the Wasatch Front sings a medley of “Lord, I Would Follow Thee” and “Love One Another.”

item.title: Daughters in the Covenant
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages women to keep their covenants, including those made at baptism, as they progress along the path back to Heavenly Father.

item.title: Let Us All Press On
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society choir from stakes in the Wasatch Front sings “Let Us All Press On.”

item.title: General Women's Meeting
item.description: The March 2014 General Women’s Meeting.

item.title: Highlight: Keeping Covenants Protects Us, Prepares Us, and Empowers Us—Rosemary M. Wixom
item.description: Rosemary M. Wixom encourages girls and women of all ages to make and keep sacred covenants in order to return to Heavenly Father's presence.

item.title: Highlight: Sisterhood: Oh, How We Need Each Other—Bonnie L. Oscarson
item.description: Bonnie L. Oscarson teaches that we can learn from girls and women of all ages and that we must avoid judging each other.

item.title: Highlight: Wanted: Hands and Hearts to Hasten the Work—Linda K. Burton
item.description: Linda K. Burton teaches that we can be devoted disciples of Jesus Christ by serving others and furthering the work of salvation.

item.title: Highlight: Daughters in the Covenant—Henry B. Eyring
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages women to keep their covenants, including those made at baptism, as they progress along the path back to Heavenly Father.

item.title: Saturday Morning Session
item.description: The Saturday Morning Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: How Wondrous and Great
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “How Wondrous and Great.”

item.title: Now Let Us Rejoice
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Now Let Us Rejoice.”

item.title: Welcome to Conference
item.description: It is my prayer that we may be filled with the Spirit of the Lord as we listen and learn.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Israel, Israel, God Is Calling.”

item.title: General Conference: Strengthening Faith and Testimony
item.description: Oh, how we need general conference! Through conferences our faith is fortified and our testimonies deepened.

item.title: Be Meek and Lowly of Heart
item.description: Being meek does not mean weakness, but it does mean behaving with goodness and kindness.

item.title: Do We Know What We Have?
item.description: Priesthood ordinances and covenants provide access to the fulness of the blessings promised to us by God, which are made possible by the Savior’s Atonement.

item.title: There Is Sunshine in My Soul Today
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “There Is Sunshine in My Soul Today.”

item.title: Look Ahead and Believe
item.description: In the sight of the Lord, it is not so much what we have done or where we have been but much more where we are willing to go.

item.title: The Windows of Heaven
item.description: Spiritual and temporal blessings come into our lives as we live the law of tithing.

item.title: Keep the Commandments
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Keep the Commandments.”

item.title: Come, Join with Us
item.description: Regardless of your circumstances, your personal history, or the strength of your testimony, there is room for you in this Church.

item.title: Come, Ye Thankful People
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Come, Ye Thankful People.”

item.title: Saturday Afternoon Session
item.description: The Saturday Afternoon Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: On This Day of Joy and Gladness
item.description: A family choir from stakes in Roy, Kanesville, Hooper, and West Haven sings “On This Day of Joy and Gladness.”

item.title: The Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring conducts the sustaining of Church officers.

item.title: I Know That My Savior Loves Me
item.description: A family choir from stakes in Roy, Kanesville, Hooper, and West Haven sings “I Know That My Savior Loves Me.”

item.title: The Key to Spiritual Protection
item.description: Peace can be settled in the heart of each who turns to the scriptures and unlocks the promises of protection and redemption.

item.title: The Moral Force of Women
item.description: Your intuition is to do good and to be good, and as you follow the Holy Spirit, your moral authority and influence will grow.

item.title: Hastening the Lord's Game Plan!
item.description: We each must develop and carry out our own personal game plan to serve with enthusiasm alongside the full-time missionaries.

item.title: Press Forward, Saints
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Press Forward, Saints.”

item.title: Small and Simple Things
item.description: Let us reach out to others with faith and with love.

item.title: Wilt Thou Be Made Whole?
item.description: As we repent and become converted to the Lord, we become whole, and our guilt is swept away.

item.title: Like a Broken Vessel
item.description: How do you best respond when mental or emotional challenges confront you or those you love?

item.title: Put Your Trust in the Lord
item.description: Become engaged in doing what you can in sharing the great message of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Love at Home
item.description: A family choir from stakes in Roy, Kanesville, Hooper, and West Haven sings “Love at Home.”

item.title: Priesthood Session
item.description: The Priesthood Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: Sing Praise to Him
item.description: An Aaronic Priesthood choir from stakes in Murray sings “Sing Praise to Him.”

item.title: Like Ten Thousand Legions Marching
item.description: An Aaronic Priesthood choir from stakes in Murray sings “Like Ten Thousand Legions Marching.”

item.title: The Doctrines and Principles Contained in the Articles of Faith
item.description: Each article of faith adds unique value to our understanding of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ye Are No More Strangers
item.description: In this Church there are no strangers and no outcasts. There are only brothers and sisters.

item.title: Called of Him to Declare His Word
item.description: If you are humble and obedient and hearken to the voice of the Spirit, you will find great happiness in your service as a missionary.

item.title: Do What Is Right
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Do What Is Right.”

item.title: You Can Do It Now!
item.description: As long as we are willing to rise up again and continue on the path, … we can learn something from failure and become better and happier.

item.title: Bind Up Their Wounds
item.description: I pray that we may prepare ourselves to give whatever priesthood service the Lord may set before us on our mortal journey.

item.title: True Shepherds
item.description: Home teaching answers many prayers and permits us to see the transformations which can take place in people’s lives.

item.title: God of Our Fathers, Whose Almighty Hand
item.description: An Aaronic Priesthood choir from stakes in Murray sings “God of Our Fathers, Whose Almighty Hand.”

item.title: Sunday Morning Session
item.description: The Sunday Morning Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: Sweet Is the Work
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Sweet Is the Work.”

item.title: Rejoice, the Lord Is King!
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Rejoice, the Lord Is King!”

item.title: Master, the Tempest Is Raging
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Master, the Tempest Is Raging.”

item.title: To My Grandchildren
item.description: There is one overarching commandment that will help us to meet the challenges and lead to the heart of a happy family life.

item.title: No Other Gods
item.description: Are we serving priorities or gods ahead of the God we profess to worship?

item.title: Be Ye Converted
item.description: True conversion occurs as you continue to act upon the doctrines you know are true and keep the commandments, day after day, month after month.

item.title: Put Your Shoulder to the Wheel
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Put Your Shoulder to the Wheel.”

item.title: The Strength to Endure
item.description: Our ability to endure to the end in righteousness will be in direct proportion to the strength of our testimony and the depth of our conversion.

item.title: Personal Strength through the Atonement of Jesus Christ
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, each of us can become clean and the burden of our rebellion will be lifted.

item.title: O Divine Redeemer
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “O Divine Redeemer.”

item.title: “I Will Not Fail Thee, nor Forsake Thee”
item.description: Our Heavenly Father … knows that we learn and grow and become stronger as we face and survive the trials through which we must pass.

item.title: We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet.”

item.title: Sunday Afternoon Session
item.description: The Sunday Afternoon Session of the April 2013 General Conference.

item.title: They, the Builders of the Nation
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “They, the Builders of the Nation.”

item.title: When He Comes Again
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “When He Comes Again.”

item.title: Lamentations of Jeremiah: Beware of Bondage
item.description: Our challenge is to avoid bondage of any kind, help the Lord gather His elect, and sacrifice for the rising generation.

item.title: Power in the Priesthood
item.description: A man may open the drapes so the warm sunlight comes into the room, but the man does not own the sun or the light or the warmth it brings.

item.title: Teaching with the Power and Authority of God
item.description: The Lord has provided the way for every worthy Latter-day Saint to teach in the Savior’s way.

item.title: Called to Serve
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Called to Serve.”

item.title: Continually Holding Fast
item.description: May we continually hold fast to the iron rod that leads to the presence of our Heavenly Father.

item.title: Look Up
item.description: Today is the time to look to the Source of truth and ensure that our testimonies are strong.

item.title: Drawing Closer to God
item.description: Our Savior wants us to really love Him to the point that we want to align our will with His.

item.title: Decisions for Eternity
item.description: The wise use of your freedom to make your own decisions is crucial to your spiritual growth, now and for eternity.

item.title: Till We Meet Again
item.description: May we show increased kindness toward one another, and may we ever be found doing the work of the Lord.

item.title: Abide with Me; 'Tis Eventide
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Abide with Me; 'Tis Eventide.”

item.title: General Relief Society Meeting
item.description: The 2013 General Relief Society Meeting.

item.title: Redeemer of Israel
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Redeemer of Israel.”

item.title: Hymn Medley
item.description: A Relief Society choir from the Provo Missionary Training Center sings a medley of “Go Forth with Faith” and “As Sisters in Zion.”

item.title: I'll Go Where You Want Me to Go
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “I'll Go Where You Want Me to Go.”

item.title: More Holiness Give Me
item.description: A Relief Society choir from the Provo Missionary Training Center sings “More Holiness Give Me.”

item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Afternoon Session

item.title: The Moral Force of Women
item.description: D. Todd Christofferon's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Afternoon Session

item.title: The Key to Spiritual Protection
item.description: Boyd K. Packer's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Afternoon Session

item.title: Come, Join with Us
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Morning Session

item.title: The Windows of Heaven
item.description: David A. Bednar's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Morning Session

item.title: General Conference: Strengthening Faith and Testimony
item.description: Robert D. Hale's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Morning Session

item.title: Welcome to Conference
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Morning Session

item.title: We Never Walk Alone
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson's talk given at the 2013 General Relief Society Meeting.

item.title: The Power, Joy, and Love of Covenant Keeping
item.description: Linda K. Burton's talk given at the 2013 General Relief Society Meeting.

item.title: Seek, Receive, Act
item.description: General conference gives us the opportunity to seek, receive, and act on personal revelation. We can receive inspired guidance to help us grow and become who Heavenly Father needs us to be.

item.title: Christine
item.description: Christine was struggling with one particular challenge, but when she heard President Uchtdorf speak at general conference, she made a commitment that would scare most of us.

item.title: Ryan
item.description: Ryan is a busy dad with active kids, who need his attention. Since general conference, he's changed his focus from screen time to family time. How have your priorities shifted in the past month?

item.title: Walter
item.description: Walter needed one message from #LDSconf and he received it. Now he's changing as a result.

item.title: Ruth
item.description: This mom wanted just one question answered when she watched general conference. Because of what she heard, her kids are now praying for peanut butter cookies and she's glad.

item.title: Look for the Lord's Hand - Veme
item.description: "Look for the Lord’s hand not only in the past, not only in our day, but also in the days to come." —Neil L. Andersen

item.title: God Hears Your Silent Prayers - Veme
item.description: "God hears your silent prayers, but you may have to learn to shut out the distractions." —Henry B. Eyring

item.title: Dreams for Our Children - Veme
item.description: "We share many of the same struggles, the same adjustments, and the same hopes, worries, and dreams for our children."—L. Tom Perry

item.title: Our Heavenly Father Wishes to Bless His Children - Veme
item.description: "Our Heavenly Father wishes to bless His children spiritually and temporally. He understands each of their needs, their pains, and their hopes." —Henry B. Eyring

item.title: Faith in the Sabbath - Veme
item.description: "Faith in God engenders a love for the Sabbath; faith in the Sabbath engenders a love for God." —Russell M. Nelson

item.title: How We Live Our Religion - Veme
item.description: "How we live our religion is far more important than what we may say about our religion." —Robert D. Hales

item.title: The Path of Discipleship - Veme
item.description: "With the gift of God’s grace, the path of discipleship does not lead backward; it leads upward.” —Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: The Wisdom of Him Who Knoweth All Things - Veme
item.description: “With prophets ancient and modern, I testify that ‘all things have been done in the wisdom of him who knoweth all things.’”—Jeffrey R. Holland

item.title: The Blessings of the Temple - Veme
item.description: "The blessings of the temple are priceless." —Thomas S. Monson

item.title: We Are on His Errand - Veme
item.description: "We are on His errand. Let us learn of Him. Let us follow in His footsteps. Let us live by His precepts." —Thomas S. Monson

item.title: A Consecrated Life - Veme
item.description: “Even the smallest act of discipleship or the tiniest ember of belief can become a blazing bonfire of a consecrated life.”—Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Following His Light - Veme
item.description: "Following His light and example will bring us joy, happiness, and peace." —Quentin L. Cook

item.title: Essential Things - Veme
item.description: "Many things are good, many are important, but only a few are essential."—D. Todd Christofferson

item.title: Source of Enduring Peace - Veme
item.description: "Correct knowledge of and faith in the Lord empower us to hush our fears."—David A. Bednar

item.title: Spiritual Food - Veme
item.description: "Spiritual food is necessary for spiritual survival." —Dallin H. Oaks

item.title: The Plan of Happiness - Veme
item.description: "The greatest reward we have received in this life, and the life to come, is our children and grandchildren.” —Boyd K. Packer

item.title: Henry B. Eyring General Women's Session March 2015
item.description: We lighten the loads of others best by helping The Lord strengthen them

category.title: Getting the Most Out of Conference
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: Find Answers to Your Questions
item.description: We can prepare for general conference by pondering questions. Guidance and direction will come as we listen to the messages of living prophets. To view all General Conference videos see Broadcast Archives

item.title: Learning from General Conference
item.description: Prophets share counsel about the blessings individuals can receive through studying the messages of general conference after the conference is over. Visit gc.lds.org for details on how to access these messages.

item.title: General Conference: Strengthening Faith and Testimony
item.description: Robert D. Hale's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Morning Session

item.title: The Blessings of General Conference
item.description: Decide now to make general conference a priority in your life. Decide to listen carefully and follow the teachings that are given.
